intro: Dunalia horrida, commonly known as the rough dunalia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, which includes many legumes. The plant is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Dunalia horrida is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
